page.title: 17Kington :A Farm Day
page.content: {(cont) It was 10.30am. I went and looked for Dad. I found him mending the mower so that he could go and mow Chapel Meadow. I saw Nan who was doing some gardening. Then I went and helped Mum who was cooking dinner. It was a fry up of bacon, eggs, tomatoes and mushrooms with bread and butter, and for pudding, jelly and ice-cream. After dinner it was so hot that I paddled in our pool, then sun bathed and read a book called Tilly Trotter by Catherine Cookson. Joanne and Andrew played cowboys and Indians. At 4pm Mum and I fetched the cows for milking. After tea I fed my calves then watched television until bedtime at 10.30pm.
